page.title: 10LONGWOOD HOUSE I
page.content: Longwood House was originally the home, in the eighteenth century, of General Lord Carpenter. The house then passed into the possession of the Ricketts family and thence to Admiral William Carnegie (Earl of Northesk, Baron Rosehill, who was third in command at the battle of Trafalgar) upon his marriage to one of the Ricketts daughters. He altered the name of the house to Rosehill, but this change did not last long and the house soon reverted to the name of Longwood. The house remained the property of the Northesk family until the early twentieth century.
